text: The request for thumbs almost ruined your comment, but you're absolutely correct. If good games only could have existed "back then", then what's the point of making new games? text: @PHILLYCHEESESTEAK26 (Continued) and professional reviewers that say Ocarina of Time is the greatest game ever made to this day. And finally I do play modern games and a lot of them are great and can compete with retro games in terms of quality for me.
author: PHILLYCHEESESTEAK26

text: @yaktr12 You must be one of those guys that think living in the now is what makes you cooler. If you compare Super Mario 64 and the Galaxy games, the amount of tasks you have to do to get a star are either much more involved in the Galaxy games or are more difficult which you probably haven't gotten to since you stopped at the game so early. Retro games are just as good as modern games, and BTW, I never even gotten into the Zelda series but their are tons and tons of video game fans
author: PHILLYCHEESESTEAK26

text: @yaktr12 I lost all respect for you now, you remind me so much of I guy I disdained cause he didn't appreciate history.
author: PHILLYCHEESESTEAK26

text: OMG Super Mario 64 was revolutionary for playing games in 3D, it was for many people the first time they played a game where they can roam around a 3D world. I believe the Galaxy series perfected the 3D platforming of the Mario series just like how SMB3 And SMW perfected the 2D side scrolling of the Mario series.
author: PHILLYCHEESESTEAK26

text: @yaktr12 Oh, and I played GTA Vice city and above. San Andreas and 4 make it in the league.
author: elenpop2

text: @yaktr12 I played Heavy Rain, Oblivion, MGS4, Fallout 3 and SSF4. I can proudly put Mario Galaxy in the league of Metal Gear Solid, Elder Scrolls and Fallout. I don't really know much about Heavy Rain because I just started playing the game but it looks really amazing with all the story. SSF4 had an amazing multiplayer but... I don't put it in that league.
author: elenpop2

text:
@yaktr12 Try pouring the amount of effort you used to beat Portal games. Why should a person try one decent game when he has 70 games? He can always grab another one if it seems to be boring at first look.

By the way, what is your favorite Wii game out of 70+ games on your hacked wii? Mario Galaxy is easily number 1 Wii game and one of the best PS3, Xbox 360 and Wii titles all together.
author: elenpop2

text: @yaktr12 MW2 was extremely repetitive for me since I already played CoD4 and I was very familiar with that gameplay. I can't believe some people find CoD still fun but not Mario Galaxy which has an incredible level design, hooking people into the game. Side-scrolling Mario was awesome, but it was still great in 3D since Mario 64. You claimed that you played Portal and also this game before, but I don't think so... You're probably judging games from someone else's opinions without playing it.
author: elenpop2

text: @yaktr12 And just shooting at people constantly isn't repetitive either?
